item.title: git tag
item.description: git tag marks a specific commit in the source repository. A common use case of the git tag is to denote software release versions by marking the points of commit history where the software was stable to release. git tag command gives the list of all tags. git tag <tagname> creates a tag named tagname. This tag points to the commit that was the head of the repo at the time of the tag creation.
